I hope you're doing fine. My family had to escape from Karabagh, a place many people probably haven't heard of. Anyways, the government basically didn't care if Armenians were being murdered for being Christian. Our village was burned down for being Christian too, and for "taking territory" that they wanted to claim. It was all messed up. And I'm thankful to the Azeris that hid us until we were able to get to escape. This was all a bit less than 30 years ago now, but so many Armenians were impacted. We had to restart from completely nothing, but at least we're alive. I always believe in the saying, "if there's a will, there's a way"
